intro: Hieracium rohlenae, commonly known as the Rohlhans' hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and has small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster, with ray florets surrounding a central disc. Hieracium rohlenae is a rare species, often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution.
